title: It's sort of like DIN but different
content:
... with a single story 'a', tailless 't', serif-footed '1' and '4' with a closed top

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414180039im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Untitled-3-01_6514.png)

Thanks.
author: russellm

comments.content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414180039im_/http:/typophile.com/files/yout-720p_5926.jpg)

sorry - here's a better resolution img.
Looks like some version of Avant Gard Condensed , maybe Elsner+Flake version.

Hmmm. That works for the 't' and figures, but the 'D', 'a' and 'p' above are more rectilinear than the Avant Gard Cond. version.

Thanks.
Look at a different version - Elsner and Flake's is more rectilinear (could also be messed with width etc)

nope.

not square enough.  
 [http://www.fonts4ever.com/search\_result.php?f\_item\_name=avant+gard&x=0&y=0](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414180039/http:/www.fonts4ever.com/search_result.php?f_item_name=avant+gard&x=0&y=0 "http://www.fonts4ever.com/search\_result.php?f\_item\_name=avant+gard&x=0&y=0")

The type is "out of the box" & would be used in the sample above on departure monitors. That much I know.

Good find Ryuk - sure looks like Ciutadella and it is more square than my thought.  
 [http://www.emtype.net/ciutadella\_font\_famiy\_01.php](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414180039/http:/www.emtype.net/ciutadella_font_famiy_01.php "http://www.emtype.net/ciutadella\_font\_famiy\_01.php")

nailed it!

Thanks Bob and Ryuk!.

Congratulations Ryuk. This certainly looks like the elusive squared adaptation of Avant Garde/Futura.  
Don
